summary: An FBI Special Agent emails colleagues to notify them of travel to Pensacola to conduct an interview in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, traveling with two Assistant U.S. Attorneys. The agent apologizes for not submitting an EC (likely expense claim or travel authorization) due to recent travel.

persons.name: SA FBI New York VCAC/I-IT
persons.context: The sender of the email, an FBI Special Agent from the New York VCAC/I-IT unit, notifying colleagues of travel to Pensacola to conduct an interview in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation referenced in the email is focused on Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: The FBI Special Agent is traveling to conduct an interview as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Travel to Pensacola for Epstein Interview
events.description: An FBI Special Agent and two Assistant U.S. Attorneys travel to Pensacola to conduct an interview in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: An active FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was ongoing as of February 2020, after his death in August 2019.
FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys were traveling to conduct interviews in the investigation.
The email indicates coordination and travel for investigative work in the Epstein case, showing the investigation's continued activity.
